author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 18. Sañcetaniyavagga
segments.en: 18. Intention

segments.pli: 180. Mahāpadesasutta
segments.en: 180. The Four Great References

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhoganagare viharati ānandacetiye.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near the city of Bhoga, at the Ānanda Tree-shrine.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “bhikkhavo”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Venerable sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “cattārome, bhikkhave, mahāpadese desessāmi,
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you the four great references.

segments.pli: taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Katame, bhikkhave, cattāro mahāpadesā?
segments.en: “Mendicants, what are the four great references?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take a mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘sammukhā metaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: ‘Reverend, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na ceva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they’re not included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ na ceva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: imassa ca bhikkhuno duggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been incorrectly memorized by that mendicant.’

segments.pli: Iti hetaṃ, bhikkhave, chaḍḍeyyātha.
segments.en: And so you should reject it.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘sammukhā metaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: ‘Reverend, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni sutte ceva otaranti vinaye ca sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they are included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: imassa ca bhikkhuno suggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been correctly memorized by that mendicant.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ mahāpadesaṃ dhāreyyātha.
segments.en: You should remember it. This is the first great reference.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse saṅgho viharati sathero sapāmokkho.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery lives a Saṅgha with seniors and leaders.

segments.pli: Tassa me saṅghassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of that Saṅgha:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na ceva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ na ceva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tassa ca saṅghassa duggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been incorrectly memorized by that Saṅgha.’

segments.pli: Iti hetaṃ, bhikkhave, chaḍḍeyyātha.
segments.en: And so you should reject it.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse saṅgho viharati sathero sapāmokkho.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery lives a Saṅgha with seniors and leaders.

segments.pli: Tassa me saṅghassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of that Saṅgha:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni, vinaye sandassiyamānāni sutte ceva otaranti vinaye ca sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they are included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tassa ca saṅghassa suggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been correctly memorized by that Saṅgha.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṃ mahāpadesaṃ dhāreyyātha.
segments.en: You should remember it. This is the second great reference.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery there are several senior mendicants who are very learned, knowledgeable in the scriptures, who remember the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of those senior mendicants:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na ceva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the monastic law, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ na ceva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tesañca therānaṃ duggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been incorrectly memorized by those senior mendicants.’

segments.pli: Iti hetaṃ, bhikkhave, chaḍḍeyyātha.
segments.en: And so you should reject it.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery there are several senior mendicants who are very learned, knowledgeable in the scriptures, who remember the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of those senior mendicants:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni sutte ceva otaranti vinaye ca sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they are included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tesañca therānaṃ suggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been correctly memorized by those senior mendicants.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ mahāpadesaṃ dhāreyyātha.
segments.en: You should remember it. This is the third great reference.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse eko thero bhikkhu viharati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery there is a single senior mendicant who is very learned and knowledgeable in the scriptures, who has memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic discipline, and the outlines.

segments.pli: Tassa me therassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of that senior mendicant:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic discipline.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na ceva sutte otaranti na vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic discipline, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ na ceva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tassa ca therassa duggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been incorrectly memorized by that senior mendicant.’

segments.pli: Iti hetaṃ, bhikkhave, chaḍḍeyyātha.
segments.en: And so you should reject it.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Take another mendicant who says:

segments.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse eko thero bhikkhu viharati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo.
segments.en: ‘In such-and-such monastery there is a single senior mendicant who is very learned and knowledgeable in the scriptures, who has memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic discipline, and the outlines.

segments.pli: Tassa me therassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ—
segments.en: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of that senior mendicant:

segments.pli: ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan’ti.
segments.en: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

segments.pli: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṃ neva abhinanditabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ.
segments.en: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

segments.pli: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
segments.en: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses and found in the texts on monastic discipline.

segments.pli: Tāni ce sutte otāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni sutte ceva otaranti vinaye ca sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: If they are included in the discourses and found in the monastic law, you should draw the conclusion:

segments.pli: ‘addhā idaṃ tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
segments.en: ‘Clearly this is the word of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tassa ca therassa suggahitan’ti.
segments.en: It has been correctly memorized by that senior mendicant.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ mahāpadesaṃ dhāreyyātha.
segments.en: You should remember it. This is the fourth great reference.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mahāpadesā”ti.
segments.en: These are the four great references.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Sañcetaniyavaggo tatiyo.
Cetanā vibhatti koṭṭhiko,
Ānando upavāṇapañcamaṃ;
Āyācana rāhula jambālī,
Nibbānaṃ mahāpadesenāti.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near the…

suttaplex.blurb: How to determine what is an authentic teaching of the Buddha.
